rice_blast.name: Rice Blast
rice_blast.description: Rice blast is a fungal disease caused by Pyricularia oryzae. It attacks all growth stages of rice. In vegetative stage, diamond-shaped spots appear on leaves (Leaf Blast). In generative stage, it attacks the neck of the panicle (Neck Blast) causing it to rot and break, resulting in empty grains. High humidity and excessive Nitrogen fertilizer worsen the condition.
rice_blast.symptoms: Diamond-shaped spots, brown borders, gray centers, broken panicle neck

rice_brown_spot.name: Brown Spot
rice_brown_spot.description: Caused by Bipolaris oryzae, often indicating poor soil health (lack of K, Si). Symptoms include oval brown spots with gray or white centers (sedame seed-like). Severe attacks cause leaves to dry and reduce grain quality.
rice_brown_spot.symptoms: Oval brown spots with gray centers, seedling blight, spotted grains

rice_bacterial_leaf_blight.name: Bacterial Leaf Blight
rice_bacterial_leaf_blight.description: Known as 'Kresek', caused by Xanthomonas oryzae. Destructive in rainy seasons with strong winds. Water-soaked streaks on leaf edges turn yellow and dry to straw-white. Can cause total wilting in seedlings.
rice_bacterial_leaf_blight.symptoms: Yellowing from leaf edges, wilting, yellow bacterial ooze

rice_sheath_blight.name: Sheath Blight
rice_sheath_blight.description: Caused by Rhizoctonia solani. Attacks leaf sheaths causing large oval greenish-gray spots with irregular brown borders. Can spread to flag leaves, causing lodging and poor grain filling.
rice_sheath_blight.symptoms: Oval greenish-gray spots on sheath, brown sclerotia

rice_tungro.name: Rice Tungro
rice_tungro.description: Viral disease transmitted by green leafhoppers. Causes yellow-orange discoloration starting from leaf tips, stunted growth, and reduced tillering. Can cause total crop failure.
rice_tungro.symptoms: Yellow-orange leaves, stunted plants, few tillers
rice_tungro.causes: RTBV and RTSV viruses transmitted by green leafhoppers

rice_grassy_stunt.name: Grassy Stunt
rice_grassy_stunt.description: Viral disease causing rice to appear grass-like. Plants are severely stunted with many small tillers and narrow leaves.
rice_grassy_stunt.symptoms: Severely stunted, excessive small tillers, narrow leaves
rice_grassy_stunt.causes: Rice Grassy Stunt Virus (RGSV) transmitted by brown planthoppers

rice_ragged_stunt.name: Ragged Stunt
rice_ragged_stunt.description: Viral disease causing ragged, serrated leaves and stunted growth.
rice_ragged_stunt.symptoms: Ragged leaves, swollen veins, stunted plants
rice_ragged_stunt.causes: Rice Ragged Stunt Virus (RRSV) transmitted by brown planthoppers

rice_stem_rot.name: Stem Rot
rice_stem_rot.description: Fungal disease causing stalks to rot and lodge. Black lesions appear near the water line.
rice_stem_rot.symptoms: Black lesions on lower stem, lodging, black sclerotia

rice_leaf_scald.name: Leaf Scald
rice_leaf_scald.description: Fungal disease causing scalded appearance on leaf tips. Lesions show zonation.
rice_leaf_scald.symptoms: Light brown zoned lesions on leaf tips, wavy edges

rice_false_smut.name: False Smut
rice_false_smut.description: Attacks individual grains, transforming them into large velvety spore balls (orange to black). Contaminates harvest and produces toxins.
rice_false_smut.symptoms: Yellow to black spore balls replacing grains

rice_narrow_brown_spot.name: Narrow Brown Spot
rice_narrow_brown_spot.description: Characterized by short, linear, narrow brown spots parallel to leaf veins.
rice_narrow_brown_spot.symptoms: Linear narrow brown spots on leaves

rice_bakanae.name: Bakanae Disease
rice_bakanae.description: Seed-borne fungal disease causing abnormal elongation ('foolish seedling'). Plants are tall, thin, pale, and often die before flowering.
rice_bakanae.symptoms: Abnormally tall and thin plants, pale yellow, aerial roots

corn_downy_mildew.name: Downy Mildew
corn_downy_mildew.description: Major threat to corn. Systemic infection causes chlorotic yellow stripes on leaves and white downy growth underneath. Plants become stunted and barren.
corn_downy_mildew.symptoms: Yellowish-white stripes, white downy growth, stunted plants

corn_leaf_blight.name: Northern Corn Leaf Blight
corn_leaf_blight.description: Causes long cigar-shaped grayish-green lesions on leaves. Heavily infected leaves dry out, reducing grain yield.

corn_rust.name: Common Rust
corn_rust.description: Reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces. Spores rub off like rust powder. Can cause early leaf senescence.

corn_southern_rust.name: Southern Rust
corn_southern_rust.description: More aggressive than common rust. Pustules are smaller, orange, and mainly on the upper leaf surface.
corn_southern_rust.symptoms: Small orange pustules on upper leaf surface

corn_stalk_rot.name: Stalk Rot
corn_stalk_rot.description: Causes stalks to rot, become soft, and plants to lodge. Interior pith disintegrates.
corn_stalk_rot.symptoms: Soft rotting stalks, lodging, internal discoloration

corn_ear_rot.name: Ear Rot
corn_ear_rot.description: Fungal infection of ears causing moldy grains (pink, white, or black). Produces dangerous mycotoxins.
corn_ear_rot.symptoms: Moldy grains, pink/white mycelium on ear

corn_gray_leaf_spot.name: Gray Leaf Spot
corn_gray_leaf_spot.description: Rectangular gray lesions delimited by leaf veins. Common in humid conditions.
corn_gray_leaf_spot.symptoms: Rectangular gray spots restricted by veins

corn_maize_streak.name: Maize Streak Virus
corn_maize_streak.description: Viral disease causing broken yellow streaks on leaves. Transmitted by leafhoppers.

corn_smut.name: Common Smut
corn_smut.description: Forms large whitish galls (tumors) filled with black spores on ears, stalks, or leaves.
corn_smut.symptoms: Large galls/tumors filled with black powder

corn_leaf_spot.name: Curvularia Leaf Spot
corn_leaf_spot.description: Small oval necrotic spots with yellow halos.
corn_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small brown spots with yellow halos

corn_crazy_top.name: Crazy Top
corn_crazy_top.description: Causes the tassel to proliferate into a mass of leafy structures.
corn_crazy_top.symptoms: Bushy proliferation of tassel, thickened leaves

corn_bacterial_stalk_rot.name: Bacterial Stalk Rot
corn_bacterial_stalk_rot.description: Rapid soft rot of the stalk with foul odor.
corn_bacterial_stalk_rot.symptoms: Soft mushy stalk, foul smell, plant collapse

chili_anthracnose.name: Anthracnose
chili_anthracnose.description: Destructive disease on chili fruits. Causes sunken circular spots with concentric rings of orange/black spores. Fruits rot and shrivel.
chili_anthracnose.symptoms: Sunken spots with concentric rings on fruit

chili_bacterial_wilt.name: Bacterial Wilt
chili_bacterial_wilt.description: Sudden wilting of plants while leaves remain green. Milky white bacterial ooze streams from cut stems in water.
chili_bacterial_wilt.symptoms: Sudden wilting, bacterial ooze from cut stem

chili_fusarium_wilt.name: Fusarium Wilt
chili_fusarium_wilt.description: yellowing of lower leaves, often on one side, followed by wilting. Vascular tissue turns brown.
chili_fusarium_wilt.symptoms: Leaf yellowing, one-sided wilting, brown vascular ring

chili_cercospora_leaf_spot.name: Cercospora Leaf Spot
chili_cercospora_leaf_spot.description: Leaf spots with gray centers and dark borders ('frogeye'). Causes defoliation.
chili_cercospora_leaf_spot.symptoms: Circular spots with gray centers and dark margins

chili_powdery_mildew.name: Powdery Mildew
chili_powdery_mildew.description: White powdery growth on leaf undersides. Leaves turn yellow and drop.
chili_powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powder on leaves, leaf curling/yellowing

chili_phytophthora_blight.name: Phytophthora Blight
chili_phytophthora_blight.description: Attacks all plant parts. Causes root rot, stem lesions, and fruit rot. Plants wilt and die.
chili_phytophthora_blight.symptoms: Stem lesions, root rot, fruit rot, wilting

chili_mosaic_virus.name: Chili Mosaic Virus
chili_mosaic_virus.description: Viral infection causing mottled light/dark green patterns on leaves, wrinkling, and stunted growth.
chili_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mosaic pattern on leaves, leaf curling, stunted plants

chili_yellow_leaf_curl.name: Yellow Leaf Curl
chili_yellow_leaf_curl.description: Transmitted by whiteflies. Leaves curl upward, turn yellow, and plants become severely stunted. No fruit production.

chili_bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot
chili_bacterial_spot.description: Small water-soaked spots on leaves and raised rough spots on fruits.
chili_bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves, scab-like spots on fruit

chili_damping_off.name: Damping Off
chili_damping_off.description: Seedlings rot at soil line and fall over.

chili_leaf_curl.name: Leaf Curl
chili_leaf_curl.description: Leaves curl, thicken, and become distorted. Caused by mites or virus.

chili_root_knot.name: Root Knot Nematode
chili_root_knot.description: Parasitic nematodes cause galls or knots on roots, blocking nutrient uptake.

tomato_late_blight.name: Late Blight
tomato_late_blight.description: Deadly disease in cool wet weather. Water-soaked spots on leaves turn black. White mold on undersides. Fruits rot.
tomato_late_blight.symptoms: Black leaf lesions, white mold, fruit rot

tomato_early_blight.name: Early Blight
tomato_early_blight.description: Target-like bullseye spots on older leaves. Leaves turn yellow and drop.

tomato_fusarium_wilt.name: Fusarium Wilt
tomato_fusarium_wilt.description: Soil-borne fungus blocks water vessels. Lower leaves yellow and wilt. Brown vascular tissue.

tomato_bacterial_wilt.name: Bacterial Wilt
tomato_bacterial_wilt.description: Rapid wilting without yellowing. Bacterial stream test positive.
tomato_bacterial_wilt.symptoms: Rapid wilting, green leaves, bacterial ooze

tomato_leaf_mold.name: Leaf Mold
tomato_leaf_mold.description: Yellow spots on upper leaf surface, olive-green velvety mold on underside. Common in greenhouses.
tomato_leaf_mold.symptoms: Yellow spots above, olive mold below

tomato_septoria_leaf_spot.name: Septoria Leaf Spot
tomato_septoria_leaf_spot.description: Small circular spots with gray centers and black specks.

tomato_mosaic.name: Tomato Mosaic
tomato_mosaic.description: Mottled leaves, fern-like leaves, streaked fruit.

tomato_yellow_leaf_curl.name: Yellow Leaf Curl
tomato_yellow_leaf_curl.description: Spread by whiteflies. Leaves curl upward, yellow margin, stunting, flower drop.

tomato_blossom_end_rot.name: Blossom End Rot
tomato_blossom_end_rot.description: Calcium deficiency causing black sunken rot on the blossom end of fruit.
tomato_blossom_end_rot.symptoms: Black sunken spot on fruit bottom

tomato_target_spot.name: Target Spot
tomato_target_spot.description: Brown spots with concentric rings, similar to early blight but often larger.

onion_purple_blotch.name: Purple Blotch
onion_purple_blotch.description: Oval white spots enlarge to become purple with concentric rings. Leaves girdle and fall.

onion_downy_mildew.name: Downy Mildew
onion_downy_mildew.description: Pale spots and violet fungal growth on leaves. Leaves collapse.
onion_downy_mildew.symptoms: Violet mold on leaves, leaf collapse

onion_fusarium_basal_rot.name: Fusarium Basal Rot
onion_fusarium_basal_rot.description: Roots rot, basal plate turns pinkish-brown, leaves yellow from tips ('Moler').
onion_fusarium_basal_rot.symptoms: Root rot, pink basal plate, twisted leaves

onion_anthracnose.name: Anthracnose (Twister)
onion_anthracnose.description: Leaves twist, curl, and have sunken oval white/orange lesions. Rapid death.

onion_white_rot.name: White Rot
onion_white_rot.description: Fluffy white mold on base of bulb with black sclerotia.
onion_white_rot.symptoms: White mold on bulb base, black specks

onion_bacterial_soft_rot.name: Bacterial Soft Rot
onion_bacterial_soft_rot.description: Bulbs become soft, watery, and smell foul. Squeeze bulb to see ooze.

onion_stemphylium_blight.name: Stemphylium Blight
onion_stemphylium_blight.description: Small light yellow to brown spots, often follows purple blotch.

onion_leaf_blight.name: Botrytis Leaf Blight
onion_leaf_blight.description: Numerous small white spots on leaves.

soybean_rust.name: Soybean Rust
soybean_rust.description: Aggressive disease causing reddish-brown pustules on lower leaves. Defoliation.

soybean_anthracnose.name: Anthracnose
soybean_anthracnose.description: Reddish-brown lesions on stems and pods. Seeds may be moldy.

soybean_mosaic.name: Soybean Mosaic
soybean_mosaic.description: Leaves are crinkled and mottled. Seeds have staining.

soybean_bacterial_pustule.name: Bacterial Pustule
soybean_bacterial_pustule.description: Small raised pustules on leaves with yellow halos.
soybean_bacterial_pustule.symptoms: Raised bumps on leaves, yellow halo

soybean_frogeye_leaf_spot.name: Frogeye Leaf Spot
soybean_frogeye_leaf_spot.description: Circular gray spots with reddish-purple borders.

soybean_charcoal_rot.name: Charcoal Rot
soybean_charcoal_rot.description: Microsclerotia make internal stem tissue look like charcoal dust. Hot dry weather disease.

soybean_sudden_death.name: Sudden Death Syndrome
soybean_sudden_death.description: Interveinal necrosis on leaves, leaves drop leaving petioles. Root rot.
soybean_sudden_death.symptoms: Yellow spots between veins, rapid death

soybean_downy_mildew.name: Downy Mildew
soybean_downy_mildew.description: Pale yellow spots on top of leaves, gray fuzzy growth underneath.
soybean_downy_mildew.symptoms: Yellow spots, gray fuzz under leaf

peanut_leaf_spot.name: Leaf Spot
peanut_leaf_spot.description: Brown or black spots on leaves causing defoliation.

peanut_rust.name: Peanut Rust
peanut_rust.description: Orange pustules on undersides of leaves.

banana_fusarium_wilt.name: Panama Disease
banana_fusarium_wilt.description: Lethal wilt disease. Leaves turn yellow and hang down like a skirt. Vascular discoloration.
banana_fusarium_wilt.symptoms: Yellow wilting leaves, internal brown rings

banana_sigatoka.name: Black Sigatoka
banana_sigatoka.description: Dark streaks on leaves causing necrosis and yield loss.

banana_bunchy_top.name: Bunchy Top
banana_bunchy_top.description: Leaves bunch at top, dark green streaks on veins.

mango_anthracnose.name: Anthracnose
mango_anthracnose.description: Black spots on leaves and fruits. Tear staining on fruit.

mango_powdery_mildew.name: Powdery Mildew
mango_powdery_mildew.description: White powder on flowers and small fruits causing drop.

papaya_ringspot.name: Papaya Ringspot
papaya_ringspot.description: Ringspot patterns on fruit, mosaic on leaves.

watermelon_fusarium_wilt.name: Fusarium Wilt
watermelon_fusarium_wilt.description: Wilting of runners or whole plant. Brown stem discoloration.

watermelon_anthracnose.name: Anthracnose
watermelon_anthracnose.description: Angular leaf spots and sunken fruit lesions.

cucumber_downy_mildew.name: Downy Mildew
cucumber_downy_mildew.description: Yellow angular spots on leaves delimited by veins.

cucumber_powdery_mildew.name: Powdery Mildew
cucumber_powdery_mildew.description: White powdery spots on leaves and stems.

cabbage_black_rot.name: Black Rot
cabbage_black_rot.description: V-shaped yellow lesions on leaf margins with black veins.

cabbage_clubroot.name: Clubroot
cabbage_clubroot.description: Roots become swollen and club-like, preventing water update.
